PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.ALSA_SELECTION_DOC:
Modular alsa: used standard alsa pipeline, DSD is converted to PCM
DSD native: Peppymeter use a separate output pipeline and does not affect the audio pipe. With this setting, bit-perfect audio is possible
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.SPOTIFY_DOC: Redirect Spotify audio to use it also with PeppyMeter
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.USBDAC_DOC:
In some circumstances Spotify stops playing after 10 seconds with USB-DAC's. In this case turn on this switch.
This inserts a copy of PCM stream to decouple the sound card and Spotify output.
Please only activate this switch if you have this effect, otherwise Spotify may generate clicks in the sound.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.AIRPLAY_DOC: Redirect Airplay audio to use it also with PeppyMeter
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.DSP_DOC:
Adjusting the audio pipe for FusionDSP.
- DSD-native is not more supported in this mode (reformat to PCM)
- Spotify no longer needs special treatment
- Attention, only enable this option, if DSP is active!
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TIMEOUT_DOC:
Timeout in seconds until Peppymeter screensaver starts.

Please set follow options in Touch Display plugin:
- The standard screensaver timeout in TouchScreen plugin should be set higher as than for PeppyMeter
-
- 'No Screensaver while playing' to 'ON'
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.POSITION_TYPE_DOC: Position of PeppyMeter screen, if screen resolution higher then meter resolution
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.ANIMATION_DOC: Animation on start and on stop of Peppymeter screensaver
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.PLAYBACK_DESC: Control display persistence during pause and track changes, and how animations react to playback progress (single track vs full queue)
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.PERSIST_DURATION_DOC:
How long to keep PeppyMeter running when playback pauses or stops.

This prevents flicker during track changes and allows brief pauses without restarting the display.

Default: 30 seconds

Set to 'Disabled' for immediate stop (original behavior).
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.PERSIST_DISPLAY_DOC:
What to show in the time display area when playback is paused.

Freeze: Keep last track time frozen (default)
Countdown: Show time until display turns off
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.QUEUE_MODE_DOC:
How cassette reels and turntable tonearm react to playback progress.

Single Track: Animations based on current track duration (default)
Full Queue: Animations based on entire queue duration

Queue mode makes reels/tonearm move across the entire playlist. Falls back to track mode for webstreams or if queue is empty.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.VUMETER_DESC: Available meters are depend on selected 'Active Meter Folder'
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.METER_DOC: Select one VU-Meter of active meter folder
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.LIST_EMPTY: No VU-Meters in list. Revert back to random mode!
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.RANDOMMODE_DOC: Switch of meters randomly on a defined timer interval or on change of music title
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.RANDOMSELECTION_DOC:
Comma separated list of meter names for using, if 'List' selected.
Available meter list for copy and paste:
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.RANDOMINTERVAL_DOC: Time interval until the next meter is displayed
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.NEEDLE_CACHE_DOC:
All pictures of selected resolution are cached for a faster switch between styles in random mode.
The cache mode is only available for systems with at least 4GB installed memory
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.CACHESIZE_DOC: Number of cached meters per selected resolution. Please be careful about increasing the value. An increased value requires more memory because more resources are cached. If there is not enough memory, the system may freeze.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.ACTIVE_FOLDER_DOC: Selection of the actively used folder for VU-Meter depend on screen resolution
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.MOUSE_DOC: For a touchscreen enable the mouse support, to have the possibility to stop the screensaver per touch. For a standard HDMI display without touch disable this option
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.DISPLAY_OUTPUT_DOC: Per default is display port 0 used on a raspberry pi for both hdmi ports. Volumio Primo use display port 1
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.INFO_MIN: The value has been adjusted to the lowest possible because the value entered is too small.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.INFO_MAX: The value has been adjusted to the highest possible because the value entered is too big.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.NAN: : The previous value was retained because the value entered is not a number.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.NO_PEPPYCONFIG: No PeppyMeter 'config.txt' found. Cannot read and save settings!
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.UNINSTALL_MSG: Please restart the system, when unistallation is complete
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.MPD_CHANGED_REBOOT: In order to change the alsa pipeline, a reboot is required
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.DSPWARNING: For a correct functionality please enable the PeppyMeter integration or disable FusionDsp.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.NODSPWARNING: For a correct functionality please disable the PeppyMeter integration or enable FusionDsp.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.NOMETERSWARNING_TITLE: You have selected an empty meters folder!
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.NOMETERSWARNING: Please copy a valid meter template to resolution folder in: /data/INTERNAL/peppy_screensaver/templates
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.NOTINLIST:
List cannot be saved.
Follow entries are not as meter section available:
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.FRAME_RATE_DOC:
Display refresh rate in frames per second (FPS).

Default: 30

Lower values reduce CPU usage but may appear less smooth.
Recommended: 20-30 for Pi 4, 15-20 for Pi 3
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.UPDATE_INTERVAL_DOC:
Spectrum and needle update frequency.

Default: 2 (updates every 2nd frame)

Higher values reduce CPU usage but decrease visual responsiveness.
At 30 FPS with interval 2: 15 updates/sec
At 20 FPS with interval 3: 6.7 updates/sec
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.METER_DELAY_DOC:
Delay between render frames in milliseconds.

Default: 10

This setting balances CPU usage and meter responsiveness.

Higher values (10-20): Lower CPU usage, meters may feel slightly sluggish
Lower values (0-5): Higher CPU usage, more responsive meters

Warning: Values below 10 can significantly increase CPU usage (up to 95%).
Recommended: 10ms for most systems.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.DEBUG_LEVEL_DOC:
Enable debug logging to /tmp/peppy_debug.log.

Off: No logging (recommended for normal use)
Basic: Essential events and errors
Verbose: Detailed information for troubleshooting
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.ANIMATION_DESC: Fade transitions between meters and playback states
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRANSITION_TYPE_DOC:
Visual transition when meter starts or stops.

None: Instant switch, no transition
Fade: Smooth fade in/out effect
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRANSITION_DURATION_DOC:
Duration of fade transition in seconds.

Default: 0.5

Range: 0.1 to 5.0 seconds
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRANSITION_COLOR_DOC:
Background color for fade transition.

Black: Fade from/to black (default)
White: Fade from/to white
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRANSITION_OPACITY_DOC:
Opacity of the fade overlay.

100%: Solid color fade (default)
50%: Semi-transparent fade
0%: No fade effect

Range: 0 to 100%
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.ROTATION_DESC: Album art and cassette spool rotation speed and quality
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.ROTATION_QUALITY_DOC:
Controls smoothness vs CPU usage for rotating elements.

Low: 4 FPS, choppy, lowest CPU
Medium: 8 FPS, balanced (default)
High: 15 FPS, smooth, higher CPU
Custom: Set your own FPS
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.ROTATION_FPS_DOC:
Custom rotation update rate.

Default: 8

Range: 4-30 FPS. Higher values use more CPU.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.ROTATION_SPEED_DOC:
Speed multiplier for spinning album art (vinyl skins).

1.0: Normal speed (default)
0.5: Half speed
2.0: Double speed

Range: 0.1 to 5.0
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.SPOOL_LEFT_SPEED_DOC:
Speed multiplier for left cassette spool.

1.0: Normal speed (default)

Adjust separately from right spool for realistic effect.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.SPOOL_RIGHT_SPEED_DOC:
Speed multiplier for right cassette spool.

1.0: Normal speed (default)

Adjust separately from left spool for realistic effect.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.SPOOL_ADAPTIVE_DOC:
When enabled, cassette spool speeds change dynamically based on playback progress.

Left spool slows down as tape depletes, right spool speeds up as tape accumulates.

Uses queue progress when Queue Mode is set to Full Queue, otherwise uses single track progress.

Can be overridden per-meter in meters.txt with spool.adaptive = true/false
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.REEL_DIRECTION_DOC:
Rotation direction for cassette spools.

Counter-clockwise: Standard direction (default)
Clockwise: Reverse direction
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.SCROLLING_DESC: Text scrolling speed for artist, title, and album display
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.SCROLLING_MODE_DOC:
How to determine text scrolling speed.

Use skin value: Use speed defined in skin (or 40 if not set)
System default: Always use 40 pixels/sec
Custom: Set individual speeds for each field
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.SCROLLING_SPEED_ARTIST_DOC:
Scrolling speed for artist text in pixels per second.

Default: 40

Lower values = slower scrolling. Range: 5-200
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.SCROLLING_SPEED_TITLE_DOC:
Scrolling speed for title text in pixels per second.

Default: 40

Lower values = slower scrolling. Range: 5-200
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.SCROLLING_SPEED_ALBUM_DOC:
Scrolling speed for album text in pixels per second.

Default: 40

Lower values = slower scrolling. Range: 5-200
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.DEBUG_LEVEL_DOC:
Controls logging to /tmp/peppy_debug.log

Off: No logging
Basic: Startup, errors, key state changes
Verbose: Configuration details (includes Basic)
Trace: Component-specific logging (use switches below)
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRACE_METERS_DOC: Log audio levels, needle position calculations, and render decisions
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRACE_SPECTRUM_DOC: Log spectrum init, update calls, and thread lifecycle
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRACE_VINYL_DOC: Log vinyl rotation state, angle, FPS gating, and skip reasons
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRACE_REEL_LEFT_DOC: Log left cassette reel state, angle, and render decisions
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRACE_REEL_RIGHT_DOC: Log right cassette reel state, angle, and render decisions
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRACE_TONEARM_DOC: Log tonearm state machine, progress input, angle calculations, and transitions
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRACE_ALBUMART_DOC: Log album art URL changes, rotation, cache hits/misses
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRACE_SCROLLING_DOC: Log artist/title/album scroll position and wrap events
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRACE_VOLUME_DOC: Log volume value changes and slider/knob position calculations
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRACE_REPEAT_DOC: Log repeat state changes (off, all, single)
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRACE_PROGRESS_DOC: Log progress percentage and seek input
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRACE_METADATA_DOC: Log every pushState event from Volumio with all values
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRACE_SEEK_DOC: Log raw vs interpolated seek, elapsed time calculations
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRACE_TIME_DOC: Log time remaining calculations and display updates
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRACE_INIT_DOC: Log meter initialization, backing captures, renderer creation
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRACE_FADE_DOC: Log fade in/out timing, lock states, skip reasons
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.TRACE_FRAME_DOC: Log render loop timing, status changes, FPS gating
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.PROFILING_DESC: CPU performance analysis tools for identifying bottlenecks
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.PROFILING_TIMING_DOC:
Log time breakdown for each render frame to /tmp/peppy_debug.log

Shows: total frame time, meter, rotation, blit, scroll, and other components.

Low overhead - safe for continuous use during testing.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.PROFILING_INTERVAL_DOC:
Log timing every N frames.

1: Every frame (verbose)
30: Once per second at 30fps (default)
300: Every 10 seconds

Lower values = more log output
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.PROFILING_CPROFILE_DOC:
Full Python function-level profiling.

WARNING: Significant CPU overhead (10-30%). Only use for short diagnostic sessions.

Creates /tmp/peppy_profile.prof and /tmp/peppy_profile_summary.txt on exit.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.PROFILING_DURATION_DOC:
Auto-stop cProfile after this many seconds.

0: Run until meter stops (not recommended)
60: One minute (default)
300: Five minutes

Prevents runaway profile file growth.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.REMOTE_DESC: Stream audio levels to remote displays over the network
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.REMOTE_SERVER_ENABLED_DOC:
Enable streaming of audio levels to remote displays.

When enabled, this device will broadcast audio level data over the network for remote PeppyMeter displays to receive.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.REMOTE_SERVER_MODE_DOC:
How to operate when remote server is enabled.

Server Only: Stream levels to remote displays, no local display (headless)
Server + Local: Both stream to remote displays AND show local display

Remote displays connect using run_peppy_remote.py on another Pi.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.REMOTE_SERVER_PORT_DOC:
UDP port for streaming audio level data to remote displays.

Default: 5580

Change if this port conflicts with other services.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.REMOTE_DISCOVERY_PORT_DOC:
UDP port for auto-discovery broadcasts.

Default: 5579

Remote clients listen on this port to find the server automatically.
PEPPY_SCREENSAVER.REMOTE_SPECTRUM_PORT_DOC:
UDP port for streaming spectrum analyzer data to remote displays.

Default: 5581

Change if this port conflicts with other services.
